body.p: South Carolina, soldier. South Carolina native. Married to Maria Louisa Garland Longstreet. Father of John G. Longstreet, Augustus B. Longstreet, James Longstreet Jr., Robert Longstreet, and James Longstreet. Resident of Alabama in 1831. Graduated from the United States Military Academy at West Point on July 1, 1842. Served in the 4th Infantry (U.S.A.). Veteran of the Mexican-American War (U.S.A). Served in the 8th Infantry (U.S.A.) from 1847 to 1858. Major in the United States Army in San Antonio, Bexar County, Texas, in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in San Antonio in 1850. Served as Paymaster (U.S.A.) from July 19, 1858, to June 1, 1861. Soldier in Albuquerque, New Mexico, in 1860. Employed Coleman Malone as a servant in Albuquerque in 1860. Resigned from the United States Army on June 1, 1861. Commissioned as a brigadier general in the Confederate Army in June 1861. Served in the Confederate Army as a brigadier general, major general, and lieutenant general from June 1861 to April 12, 1865.
